home.title: WE DO THE HOUSING, YOU DO THE CITY

2.title: we search, we visit, you choose

howWeWork.title: RELOCATION MADE EASY
howWeWork.subtitle: We are a relocation agency specialized in the real estate sector of Madrid and Barcelona, providing advice and guidance to help you find the home that best suits your needs.

0.title: Complete guidance:
0.body: We support you through every step of the rental process.

1.title: Personalized search:
1.body: We find and visit properties that match your needs and evaluate each option objectively.

2.title: Full management:
2.body: We handle paperwork, negotiation, contracts, and payments.

3.title: Warm welcome:
3.body: We welcome you to your new home in Spain, hand over your keys, and do complete the inventory of the house.

0.title: Your ideal home, tailored to you

4.title: Local area guidance and lifestyle tips

about.title: About us
about.content: We provide modern stays with digital check-in and 24/7 support.

0.title: We are Ana and Paloma, two Mexicans living in Spain. When we first arrived as students, we faced the challenging process of finding a home in a new country.

1.title: With Ana’s 10-year experience in relocation services and Paloma’s expertise in the Real Estate industry. We soon realized that many other international students were going through the same struggle — endless searches, scams, and a lot of uncertainty.

2.title: Intending to make this experience easier, safer, and more human, we decided to create an agency that supports people arriving in Spain and helps them find their new home with confidence and peace of mind.

3.title: Over time, word of mouth led us to help more than 300 students from different countries find housing in cities like Madrid and Barcelona.

4.title: Today, we collaborate with universities and real estate agencies that endorse our professionalism and trust our commitment to providing a reliable and personalized service.

0.question: Are you a real estate agency?
0.answer: No, we are a relocation agency that specializes in helping people find housing in Madrid and Barcelona. We work closely with several real estate agencies to offer our clients a wide range of verified properties.

1.question: What is the difference between a temporary and long-term apartment?
1.answer: To rent a property in Spain, you typically need to provide valid identification or a passport, proof of income (such as pay stubs or bank statements), and a rental application form. Additional documents may be required depending on the landlord's requirements.

2.question: What do I need to apply for a temporary apartment?
2.answer: To rent an apartment in Spain, you typically need to pay the first month's rent, a security deposit (usually one month's rent), and possibly a agency fee (if you are using a relocation agency). Please contact us for detailed pricing information.

3.question: What documents do I need to rent?
3.answer: Agency fees are a standard part of the rental process in Spain. However, we strive to provide transparent pricing and will inform you of any fees upfront.

4.question: What payments are required?
4.answer: No, we help review lease agreements, negotiate terms, and handle all necessary documentation to ensure a smooth transition to your new home.

5.question: Can agency fees be avoided?
5.answer: Our service includes assistance in finding suitable properties, organizing viewings, negotiating lease terms, and handling all necessary documentation to ensure a smooth transition to your new home.

6.question: Is it just for students?
6.answer: 1. Contact us to discuss your needs. 2. We will help you find suitable properties. 3. We will organize viewings and assist with negotiations. 4. Complete all necessary documentation for a smooth transition.

7.question: What does your service include?
7.answer: 1. Your contact information (name, phone number, email). 2. A brief introduction about yourself. 3. Your reasons for moving and what you are looking for in a new home. 4. Any specific requirements or preferences you may have.

8.question: What are the steps to follow?
8.answer: 1. Your contact information (name, phone number, email). 2. A brief introduction about yourself. 3. Your reasons for moving and what you are looking for in a new home. 4. Any specific requirements or preferences you may have.

9.question: What should my cover letter include?
9.answer: 1. Your contact information (name, phone number, email). 2. A brief introduction about yourself. 3. Your reasons for moving and what you are looking for in a new home. 4. Any specific requirements or preferences you may have.
